TEXT.English: It is the year 1700 AD. Denmark is a shadow of its former. Once the premier power throughout Scandinavia, the 17th century saw the collapse of the Kalmar Union, Protestant Reformation, 30 Years War, and a slew of wars against Sweden. Only shrewd diplomacy will determine whether Denmark will regain what it has lost or end up undergoing even further disintegration...

It is the year 1075 AD. The hills at the confluence of the Shashi and Limpopo rivers control the local gold and cattle trade and are also prime country for hunting elephants for their valuable ivory. From this vantage point new innovations in stonework will take place, and these structures will grow ever grander as the grandeur of these kingdoms grows.
It is the year 650 AD. Bamar settlers from the Pyu City states at the confluence of the Irrawaddy and Chindwin Rivers have migrated west to found the Kingdom of Pagan...
It is the year 1700 AD. The golden age of the Toungoo Empire has long since ended...
It is the year 1700 AD. We don't know a lot about this era in the history of the Khmer.

It is the year 882 AD. Varangian travelers among the amber road between Scandinavia and Byzantium begin to set up states along their routes. Quickly mingling with their Slavic subjects, they would become the Rus and set out to settle the vast areas of Eastern Europe and beyond.
It is the year 895 AD. Following their conquest of the Carpathian Basin, the Magyar peoples form the Principality of Hungary...
It is the year 751 AD. Seeking to form a nation ruled not by an absolute political or military ruler but by the will of god, the Azd Ibadi Muslims form the Imamate of Oman...
It is the year 1700 AD. Against all odds the Omani people have ousted their Portugese colonizers, invaded their colonies, and become an imperial power in their own right...

It is the year 819 AD. Following their victories, a new amir of Yemen has been appointed Amir of Yemen with the task of restraining the Alid Shi'a influence in the area. As Abbasid rule continues to wane and the spice trade from India continues to bolster Yemen's growth, the Yemeni nation is in a prime position to become the new face of the Arabian peninsula.

It is the year 650 AD. Following the breakup of the Western Turkic Khaganate, a group of Turkic peoples head west to found a new Khaganate. Positioned astride a major artery of the Silk Road, word of the tolerant Khazar Khaganate will soon spread far and wide, attracting a variety of peoples from disenfranchised faiths.
It is the year 1700 AD...
It is the year 2500 BC. Threatened and inspired by the growing might and culture of their northern neighbors, the Nubian peoples found the Kerma Kingdom...
It is the year 600 AD. Following the collapse of the Kingdom of Kush, the Kingdom of Makuria rises in hopes of reviving the Nubian Dynasty and maintaining the rule of Orthodox Christianity...
It is the year 1700 AD. A center of the arts and sciences, the Funj Sultanate has managed to stave off the aggressions of their Ottoman neighbors...

It is the year 700 AD. The Kanembu peoples settle along the banks of Lake Chad. While lacking in fertility, the region's vast aquifiers and strategic position between the wealthy Arabians and resource rich Sub-Saharan will surely draw the attention of the Trans-Saharan trade that thrives to their west.

It is the year 1700 AD. After the death of the Idris Alooma nearly a century ago, the Bornu Empire has been slowly fading. The Trans-Saharan trade no longer flows through the hear of the continent, and the western reaches of their former empire has since broke off from the crown...

It is the year 1200 BC. As the social structure of the Germanic Celtic culture grows in its complexity, an elite class of chieftains and warriors begin taking the first steps towards consolidating power. With an advanced knowledge of Metal Working and abundant fertile land, the Celtic culture is set to spread far and wide.
It is the year 3000 BC. Settling along the river beds of the Fortaleza, Pativilca, and Supe rivers, the Andean peoples form the first civilizations in the Americas...

It is the year 110 AD. As the invention of ceramics strengthens existing trade routes, the pilgrimige site of Tiwanaku begins growing into a true city and the first great regional power since the fall of the Norte Chican Civilization. With an economy built on the seasonal swelling of visitors from far and wide, the city of Tiwanaku is primed to grow into an empire of great fame and glory.
It is the year 400 AD. North of the flourishing Tiwanaku, the rise of the Wari Empire heralds what will soon become the first major Andean power struggle...
It is the year 600 AD. The Tiwanaku Empire is in the middle of a cold war with their northern neighbors...
It is the year 600 AD. The Wari Empire is in the middle of a cold war with their southern neighbors...
It is the year 900 AD. Taking advantage of their neighbor's preoccupation in their cold war with the Tiwanaku, the Chimu people take the first steps towards the formation of an Empire of their own...
It is the year 100 BC. The consolidation of the Ohio Hopewell tradition marks the first major step towards the development of complex civilization north of the Mexican Altiplano...
It is the year 200 BC. The Inuit's arrival to the Bering Strait marks the beginning of what will become one of the longest lasting cultures of the arctic.

It is the year 800 AD. The formation end of the Hererra period heralds in a new age for the peopel of the Altiplano Cundiboyacense. The rise of the Muisca Confederation marks the start in a new golden age of American trade.

It is the year 1600 BC. In the tropical lowlands near the Gulf of Mexico, population reaches the critical threshold for the formation of complex societies. This sixth cradle of civilization will see the rise of the Olmecs, forerunners to all Mesoamerican cultures.
TEXT.French: Nous sommes en l'an 1600 av. J.-C. Dans les basses-terres tropicales près du golfe du Mexique, la population atteint le seuil nécessaire à la formation de sociétés complexes. Ce sixième berceau de la civilisation verra l'émergence des Olmèques, précurseurs de toutes les cultures mésoaméricaines.
TEXT.German: It is the year 1600 BC. In the tropical lowlands near the Gulf of Mexico, population reaches the critical threshold for the formation of complex societies. This sixth cradle of civilization will see the rise of the Olmecs, forerunners to all Mesoamerican cultures.
